step_data.thought:
Looking at the current state of the page, I can see that I'm already on the 'Orders Report' page under the Sales Reports section. This is indicated by the heading 'Orders Report' and the URL which contains 'reports/report_sales/sales/'. The user's goal was to view Reports, and I've successfully navigated to one of the report pages.

The page shows a report interface with various filtering options like Date Used, Period, From/To dates, Order Status, etc. The report table is visible but currently shows '0 records found' with a message 'We couldn't find any records.' This is likely because no specific date range has been set or the report hasn't been generated yet.

Since I've already navigated to the Reports section and am viewing the Orders Report, I should inform the user that I've completed their request to view Reports and explain what they're currently seeing.
step_data.action: stop('I have navigated to the Reports section and opened the Orders Report. You are currently viewing the Orders Report page where you can generate sales order reports by configuring filters like date range, order status, and other parameters. To generate a report, you can fill in the date range and click the "Show Report" button.')
